Intensity: Help, LORD, for no one is faithful anymore; those who are loyal have vanished from the human race.
Text: David starts the Psalm with an urgent plea for help, expressing a sense of isolation and moral decline in society.
Everyone lies to their neighbor; they flatter with their lips but harbor deception in their hearts.
Context: David laments the pervasive dishonesty and deceitful flattery among the people.

Text: May the LORD cut off all flattering lips and every boastful tongue
Context: He calls for God’s judgment against those who use their words to manipulate and boast.

Text: Those who say, “By our tongues we will prevail; our own lips will defend us—who is lord over us?”
Context: David criticizes the arrogance of those who rely on their own words rather than on God’s sovereignty.

Text: “Because the poor are plundered and the needy groan, I will now arise,” says the LORD. “I will protect them from those who malign them.”
Context: The verse shifts to express God's concern for the oppressed and His promise to act on their behalf.

Text: And the words of the LORD are flawless, like silver purified in a crucible, like gold refined seven times.
Context: David contrasts the deceitful words of people with the pure and trustworthy words of the LORD.

Text: You, LORD, will keep the needy safe and will protect us forever from the wicked
Context: David expresses his trust in God’s enduring protection against the wicked.

Text: who freely strut about when what is vile is honored by the human race.
Context: Despite the fact that society honors what is vile, David assures the reader of God's continued protection.

Text: The translation reflects David's lament over deceitful speech and the moral decline he observes, his prayer for divine judgment, and his reassurance of God's protection and faithfulness.
